oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Haltung exotischer Rinder in Deutschland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blodau, Simon
Lenger, Freerk
Schwenzer, Janusch
Hörning, Prof. Bernhard
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dairy cattle
Health and welfare
Feeding and growth
Beef cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Exotic cattle keeping in Germany is increasing (zebu, domestic water buffalo, bison). The aim of the study was to collect key features of German farms with these cattle species. Questionnaires from 20 farms keeping zebu and 21 farms keeping bison were evaluated. Five farms keeping dairy buffaloes were visited. No differences between conventional and organic farms were found.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Blodau, Simon; Lenger, Freerk; Schwenzer, Janusch and Hörning, Prof. Bernhard (2009) Haltung exotischer Rinder in Deutschland. Poster at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
